revision.text: {{ZScriptNote}} __NOTOC__ '''[[Classes:Actor|Actor]]''' native clearscope static Vector2 '''RotateVector'''(Vector2 vec, double angle) == Usage == Rotates a 2D vector by the given angle. Used to get a vector to point in a new direction without modifying the magnitude of the vector. Note: Despite being defined in {{class|Actor}}, this function is clearscope (can be called in any class or [[Object scopes and versions|scope]]). In classes that aren't based on {{class|Actor}}, it has to be called as Actor.RotateVector. === Parameters === *{{c|Vector2 '''vec'''}} :The 2D vector to rotate *{{c|double '''angle'''}} :How many degrees to rotate the vector by. Negative values rotate it clockwise while positive values rotate it counterclockwise. === Return value === Returns the rotated Vector2. == Examples == {{noexamples}} [[Category:ZScript]] [[Category:Actor static functions]]
